result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 12/15/15; alternate 5 days jail consecutive.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

Court grants 15 days credit.
TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ryan D Knight in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court strikes the repeater.  The Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count #1 with the repeater stricken.  The Court finds the Defendant guilty. The Defendant is sentenced to the following:
JAIL:    15 Days,  15 Days credit for TIME SERVED.
COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 12/15/15, 5 days jail consecutive as penalty for nonpayment. 
Court waives the DNA Surcharge based on date of violation.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Jefferson County Jail.
